alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued January 28 at 3:39AM EST until January 28 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...BRIEF SHALLOW COASTAL FLOODING POSSIBLE AROUND HIGH TIDE THIS MORNING IN DOWNTOWN CHARLESTON... Tide levels in the Charleston Habor could briefly reaching 7 ft MLLW with high tide this morning. This will likely result in some brief, shallow coastal flooding in some of the normal locations throughout Downtown Charleston, including areas adjacent to Gadsden Creek. Motorists should be alert for saltwater across parts of Fishburne Street and Hagood Avenue. High tide in the Charleston Harbor will occur just after 408 AM.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
